user.description:
Enter an access key or host and port.
"Use Media Network to share this library and enable DLNA" must be enabled in Options > Media Network.

data_description.api_key: The access key shown in Options > Media Network.
data_description.name: A memorable name for the server, will default to the hostname if discovered via an access key
data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of the system hosting your JRiver Media Server.

credentials.description: Please enter your JRiver Media Server user name and password. These can be found in Options > Media Network > Authentication

macs.description:
Select the MAC addresses that should be used for wake on lan.
Requires the Home Assistant Wake on LAN integration to be enabled.

data.use_wol: Configure remote.wake service? (requires at least 1 MAC address)

paths.description: Please select the remote views that you want to be able to browse in Home Assistant. These can be found in the "Customize views for JRemote, Gizmo and Panel" configuration in Options > Media Network > Advanced. Upgrade to MC32 to remove the need to provide this information manually.

zones.description: Choose whether to expose zones as separate devices.

select_zones.description: Choose which zones to expose as a device.

select_playback_fields.description: Specify additional library fields to expose as attributes on the playing now sensor(s).

error.no_zones: Must select at least one zone.
error.no_mac_addresses: Must provide at least one MAC address or disable WOL support.
error.invalid_mac: Invalid MAC address, must be 6 pairs of hex digits separated by :

init.description: Please select the remote views that you want to be able to browse in Home Assistant. These can be found in the "Customize views for JRemote, Gizmo and Panel" configuration in Options > Media Network > Advanced. Upgrade to MC32 to remove the need to provide this information manually.

fields.description: Specify additional library fields to expose as attributes on the playing now sensor(s).

macs.description:
Select the MAC addresses that should be used for wake on lan.

error.no_mac_addresses: Must provide at least one MAC address or disable WOL support.
error.invalid_mac: Invalid MAC address, must be 6 pairs of hex digits separated by :

add_to_playlist.name: Add to playlist
add_to_playlist.description: Adds library items to the Playing Now playlist. Must provide either a query or a playlist.

query.name: Search Query
query.description: A JRiver search expression as per https://wiki.jriver.com/index.php/Search_Language

playlist_path.name: Playlist Path
playlist_path.description: A path to a playlist to play.

seek_relative.name: Relative position seek
seek_relative.description: Move forward or backward by the specified amount in seconds.

seek_duration.name: Seek amount
seek_duration.description: Number of seconds to seek forwards or backwards.

adjust_volume.name: Relative volume adjustment
adjust_volume.description: Change volume up or down by a given amount.

block.name: Controls whether the call is blocking
block.description: true to block, false to return immediately

wake.name: Use Wake On Lan to wake the MediaServer
